channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-1950] Got error message from Hawito after creating AMQ cartridge
item.description:
After creating the first AMQ cartridge, got these errors from Hawtio:

2014-09-15 15:40:51 WARNio.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStore Fetch failed because of: http://amq-395.fuse-vsphere.com:80/git/fabric/: cannot open git-upload-pack
2014-09-15 15:40:53 WARNorg.apache.felix.eventadmin EventAdmin: Exception: java.lang.InterruptedException
2014-09-15 15:40:53 ERRORorg.fusesource.mq.fabric.ActiveMQServiceFactory Exception on start: org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanDefinitionStoreException: IOException parsing XML document from class path resource [profile:broker.xml]; nested exception is java.io.FileNotFoundException: class path resource [profile:broker.xml] cannot be opened because it does not exist
2014-09-15 15:40:53 WARNio.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStore Fetch failed because of: http://amq-395.fuse-vsphere.com:80/git/fabric/: cannot open git-upload-pack
2014-09-15 15:41:11 WARNio.hawt.maven.indexer.MavenIndexerFacade Destroying MavenIndexer while indexing is still in progress, this could lead to errors ...
2014-09-15 15:41:27 ERRORorg.apache.zookeeper.server.NIOServerCnxnFactory Thread Thread[MavenIndexerFacade startup timer,5,io.hawt.hawtio-maven-indexer-1.2.0.redhat-395] died
item.summary: Got error message from Hawito after creating AMQ cartridge

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I just tested against this version:
openshift-origin-cartridge-amq-6.1.0.redhat.396-1.el6op.noarch

I did not see any errors in the logs.

When creating AMQ app as a root container, i still get these error files from <app-url>/hawtio/index.html#/logs?p=container&l=WARN . You can also check "~/amq/container/data/log/karaf.log" file in app.
2014-09-17 00:17:38 WARNorg.apache.curator.framework.state.ConnectionStateManager There are no ConnectionStateListeners registered.
2014-09-17 00:17:58 WARNio.hawt.config.ConfigFacade No ConfigFacade constructed yet so using default configuration for now
2014-09-17 00:18:06 WARNio.hawt.maven.indexer.MavenIndexerFacade Destroying MavenIndexer while indexing is still in progress, this could lead to errors ...
2014-09-17 00:18:15 ERRORorg.apache.zookeeper.server.NIOServerCnxnFactory Thread Thread[MavenIndexerFacade startup timer,5,io.hawt.hawtio-maven-indexer-1.2.0.redhat-396] died

The detail information for the last ERROR:
2014-09-17 00:18:15,408 | ERROR | de startup timer | NIOServerCnxnFactory | er.server.NIOServerCnxnFactory$1 44 | 54 - io.fabric8.fabric-zookeeper - 1.0.0.redhat-396 | Thread Thread[MavenIndexerFacade startup timer,5,io.hawt.hawtio-maven-indexer-1.2.0.redhat-396] died
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/codehaus/plexus/util/FileUtils
at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater.loadIndexDirectory(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:242)
at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater.access$300(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:76)
at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater$LuceneIndexAdaptor.setIndexFile(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:642)
at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater.fetchAndUpdateIndex(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:862)
at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater.fetchAndUpdateIndex(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:157)
at io.hawt.maven.indexer.MavenIndexerFacade.downloadOrUpdateIndices(MavenIndexerFacade.java:178)
at io.hawt.maven.indexer.MavenIndexerFacade.init(MavenIndexerFacade.java:133)
at io.hawt.maven.indexer.AsyncMavenIndexerFacadeFactory.createMavenIndexer(AsyncMavenIndexerFacadeFactory.java:134)
at io.hawt.maven.indexer.AsyncMavenIndexerFacadeFactory$1.run(AsyncMavenIndexerFacadeFactory.java:49)
at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:555)[:1.7.0_65]
at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:505)[:1.7.0_65]
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Unable to load class 'org.codehaus.plexus.util.FileUtils' because the bundle wiring for io.hawt.hawtio-maven-indexer is no longer valid.
at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1494)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.0.3.redhat-610396.jar:]
at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:75)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.0.3.redhat-610396.jar:]
at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1955)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.0.3.redhat-610396.jar:]
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:358)[:1.7.0_65]
... 11 more
I tried openshift-origin-cartridge-amq-6.1.0.redhat.396-1.el6op.noarch as well and couldn't reproduce the NoClassDefFoundError exception... do you hit it every time?

Yep, i hit it every time. Version:391-1

2014-09-24 14:55:57 WARNio.hawt.config.ConfigFacade No ConfigFacade constructed yet so using default configuration for now
2014-09-24 14:55:59 WARNio.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStore Fetch failed because of: http://amq-691.fuse-vsphere.com:80/git/fabric/: cannot open git-upload-pack
2014-09-24 14:56:06 WARNio.hawt.maven.indexer.MavenIndexerFacade Destroying MavenIndexer while indexing is still in progress, this could lead to errors ...
2014-09-24 14:56:49 ERRORorg.apache.zookeeper.server.NIOServerCnxnFactory Thread Thread[MavenIndexerFacade startup timer,5,io.hawt.hawtio-maven-indexer-1.2.0.redhat-396] died

In the log file:container/data/log/karaf.log
per - 1.0.0.redhat-396 | Thread Thread[MavenIndexerFacade startup timer,5,io.hawt.hawtio-maven-indexer-1.2.0.redhat-396] died
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/codehaus/plexus/util/FileUtils
at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater.loadIndexDirectory(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:242)
at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater.access$300(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:76)

at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater.fetchAndUpdateIndex(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:862)
at org.apache.maven.index.updater.DefaultIndexUpdater.fetchAndUpdateIndex(DefaultIndexUpdater.java:157)
at io.hawt.maven.indexer.MavenIndexerFacade.downloadOrUpdateIndices(MavenIndexerFacade.java:178)
at io.hawt.maven.indexer.MavenIndexerFacade.init(MavenIndexerFacade.java:133)
at io.hawt.maven.indexer.AsyncMavenIndexerFacadeFactory.createMavenIndexer(AsyncMavenIndexerFacadeFactory.java:134)
at io.hawt.maven.indexer.AsyncMavenIndexerFacadeFactory$1.run(AsyncMavenIndexerFacadeFactory.java:49)
at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:555)[:1.7.0_65]
at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:505)[:1.7.0_65]
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Unable to load class 'org.codehaus.plexus.util.FileUtils' because the bundle wiring for io.hawt.hawtio-maven-indexer is no longer valid.
at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1494)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.0.3.redhat-610396.jar:]
at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:75)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.0.3.redhat-610396.jar:]

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. Create AMQ app (root container)
2. Check the log from Hawito (filer 'WARNING')
